sentences.en: Autumn treats all humans alike , regardless of nationality, race or class.
sentences.cn: 秋之于人, 何尝有国别,更何尝有人种阶级的区别呢?

sentences.en: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.cn: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

sentences.en: I could do that blindfold , ie easily , regardless of obstacles.
sentences.cn: 我蒙着眼也能做(不费吹灰之力, 无视任何障碍).

sentences.en: I protested, but she carried on regardless.
sentences.cn: 我极力反对, 但她仍一意孤行.

sentences.en: I shall go regardless of the weather.
sentences.cn: 无论天气好坏我都要去.

sentences.en: It takes in anybody regardless of religion, colour, or creed.
sentences.cn: 任何人，不论宗教、肤色或信仰，都可以加入。

sentences.en: Regardless of danger, he climbed the pagoda.
sentences.cn: 他不顾危险地爬上了高塔.

sentences.en: Regardless of danger, he climbed the tower.
sentences.cn: 他不顾危险地爬上了高塔。

sentences.en: Regardless of how often I correct him, he always makes the same mistake.
sentences.cn: 不管我怎样经常告诫他, 他总是犯同样的错误.

sentences.en: Regardless of whether he is right or wrong, we have to abide by his decisions.
sentences.cn: 不管他正确与否，我们都得服从他的决定。

sentences.en: She kept her eyes on me in a cool, regardless manner.
sentences.cn: 她一直非常讨厌地 、 冷冷地盯着我.

sentences.en: the allowance is paid regardless of age or income.
sentences.cn: 津贴发放不分年龄或收入。

sentences.en: The club welcomes all new members regardless of age.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部对所有新成员不分年龄一律欢迎。

sentences.en: The fields give high and stable yields regardless of climatic circumstances.
sentences.cn: 不管天气条件如何,这块地总是保持稳产高产.

sentences.en: The new tax laws were rammed through regardless of the opposition of the majority of the people.
sentences.cn: 不顾大多数人民的反对，新的税法强行通过了。

sentences.en: The old wolf dashes regardless into the bush.
sentences.cn: 狼发疯般不顾一切地冲进灌木林.

sentences.en: We mustn't attempt unrestricted expansion regardless if it is within our capacity.
sentences.cn: 我们不能不顾自己的能力企图无限制地发展.

words.tran_cn: 留心的；表示敬意的；深切注意的；关心的
注重，考虑；看待；尊敬；把…看作；与…有关

phrases.tran_cn: 不顾，不管；无论，不论，不分

trans.tran_cn: 不顾后果地，不管怎样，无论如何，不惜费用地
trans.tran_en: without being affected or influenced by something
